com.sprhibrad.framework.controller

Class ShrController<T extends ShrEntity>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sprhibrad.framework.controller.ShrController<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - any class (of the model) that implements ShrEntity or its descendant.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HomePageController, ImplShrController

    public abstract class ShrController<T extends ShrEntity>
extends java.lang.Object
    The SprHibRAD core class for the Controller activity. Beyond invoking the service layer it manages the navigation using a stack of NavigatorNode. The latter will be then used by the view helper classes (SprHibRAD custom tag classes) for the rendering of the navigation bar. In SprHibRAD the controller layer is kept at the default Spring configuration for efficiency, that is any controller object lives as singleton: this is why the http session object comes into play providing status for user preferences and navigation stack. The member of this class, indeed, are injected by Spring get their current value from the session object. It was chosen to use the http session object through the classical api instead of the Spring directives (@Session etc..) because I have actually not understood their use.
